title: Yasuo's windwall shouldn't give him 360 degrees of protection at the moment of casting.
body:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?time_continue=1&v=iRsUFhfXAt8

in this video you could clearly see that when the moment he casted his windwall, the ezreal ult was quite literally ontop of him and should have hit him but... yasuo casted his windwall.

https://imgur.com/a/zPmQKsv
lets ignore the fact that he didn't even aim it properly because this bullshit windwall works like a 360 degrees all-around protection from everything
because the way it forms is from his center of the champion and moves outwards. basically gives him complete safety from every angle for the first few moments.

make it form directly infront of him at a fixed distance from him.
it will make it so projectiles that have actually passed that fixed distance would infact hit yasuo.
it would punish him for reacting slow and for missing the windwall's direction, because right now there is 0 punishment for it.

Yasuo's windwall starts from behind him, then within around 0.25 - 0.33 seconds goes in front of him.

As much as I TOTALLY agree that Yasuo's windwall shouldn't block Vel'Koz's W when it's obviously ground-targeted and not a projectile and should hurt him since the rift effect is LITERALLY UNDER HIM.

It's a barrier effect, like Braum's unbreakable.

Meaning if a skillshot is the width of Ezreal's ult, it'll hit the side of it and dissolve it.
Not in a million years will riot ever care about fixing yasuo, in any way, shape, or form. I agree that this shouldn't be how things are, but we need to be a little realistic.
